sentences: Päeval päästsid lemmikloomu kui ta oli piinatud taevas all.
See inimene usub, et ta päästis oma elu juhul, kus ta said olla surmavalt haigustada.
Rohkem kui 100 inimest päästsid põlengu järgselt. (More than 100 people were saved following the fire.)
context: The word 'päästsid' is a past tense verb meaning you saved, or someone else saved. It comes from the Estonian verb 'päästa', which means to save or rescue. The form here is used when addressing someone directly (you saved) or describing an action completed by another person or people in the past.
